4.heading: Charlie.
4.title: All Dogs Go to Heaven [videorecording]
4.author: United Artists Pictures.
notes: Featuring the voices of Loni Anderson, Judith Barsi, Dom De Luise, Melba Moore, Charles Nelson Reilly, Burt Reynolds, and Vic Tayback.

Score by Ralph Burns ; original songs by Charles Strouse and T.J. Kuenster ; screenplay by David Weiss ; executive producers George A. Walker and Morris F. Sullivan ; co-directors Gary Goldman and Dan Kuenster ; produced by Don Bluth, Gary Goldman, and John Pomeroy ; directed by Don Bluth.

Summary (from OCLC): Out for revenge against his double-crossing former partner, the roguish German Shepherd Charlie finds himself guardian to a lonely little orphan named Anne-Marie, and her astounding ability to talk to animals leads this unlikely pair on an adventure packed with thrills, laughter, tears, and true love.

13.heading: Charlie.
13.title: "The Escape Chronicle"
13.author: story, Budd Lewis ; art, Jose Ortiz
notes: "Kenward, Bernard B: #9993030. Spindled. Folded. Mutilated by life. Charlie: No last name. No number. Liberated. Grew vegetables. Brewed wine. And thought. It would take only two men to build a giant balloon. To sail away. To escape death by computerized boredom!"

150.title: Charlie Chicken
150.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Charlie Chicken notices muddy water in the pipes, so Andy opens a pipe and floods the basement. They go outside to find the water main and shut it off, but end up digging all the way around the house before they accidentally break the main pipe. They end up with a moat, so they build a drawbridge. The mailman falls in, then two policemen, and a law librarian finds a law from the year 1591 against moats. By the time the research is done and the police return, Andy and Charlie have filled in the moat. The tap water is still muddy.

151.title: Charlie Chicken
151.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Andy and Charlie try to volunteer for a jungle expedition to the island of Pango-Pango. Professor Mossbank, the big game hunter for the museum of art, rejects them, but they stow away, and manage to rescue the professor from being burned alive by natives.
